content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a function written in Julia that will filter out any words that do not start with a capital letter from a list of strings:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words::Vector{String})
    return filter(startswith(uppercasefirstletter), words) do word
        return starts_with_capital(word)
    end
end

# Utility function to check if a string starts with a capital letter
function starts_with_capital(word::String)::Bool
    return uppercase(word[1]) == word[1]
end
```

To use this function, you would call it with a list of words:

```julia
# Example usage
words = ["dog", "Cat", "apple", "Dinosaur"]
filtered_words = keep_only_names(words)
println(filtered_words) # Should print the list without "dog" and "apple" because they don't start with a capital letter
```

Please note that this function assumes that the input words are already in lowercase. If your input contains uppercase words that do not start with a capital letter, you will need to define what you mean by "capital letter" (e.g., whether you want to convert the entire word to lowercase or just the first letter) and adjust the function accordingly.
